verses.verse: And the life of Sarah<WH8283> was<WH2416> a hundred<WH3967> and seven<WH7651> and twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141>: these were the years<WH8141> of the life<WH2416> of Sarah<WH8283>.

And Sarah<WH8283> died<WH4191> in Kiriath-arba<WH7153> (the same is Hebron<WH2275>), in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>: and Abraham<WH85> came<WH935> to mourn<WH5594> for Sarah<WH8283>, and to weep for her<WH1058>.
And Abraham<WH85> rose up<WH6965> from before<WH6440> his dead<WH4191>, and spake<WH1696> unto the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>, saying<WH559>,
I am a stranger<WH1616> and a sojourner<WH8453> with you<WH5414>: give me a possession<WH272> of a burying-place<WH6913> with you<WH6912>, that I may bury my dead<WH4191> out of my sight<WH6440>.
And the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845> answered<WH6030> Abraham<WH85>, saying unto him<WH559>,

Hear us<WH8085>, my lord<WH113>; thou art a prince<WH5387> of God<WH430> among us<WH8432>: in the choice<WH4005> of our sepulchres<WH6913> bury<WH6912> thy dead<WH4191>; none<WH3808> of us shall withhold<WH3607> from thee his sepulchre<WH6913>, but that thou mayest bury<WH6912> thy dead<WH4191>.
And Abraham<WH85> rose up<WH6965>, and bowed<WH7812> himself to the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776>, even to the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>.

And he communed<WH1696> with them<WH559>, saying, If it be<WH3426> your mind<WH5315> that I should bury<WH6912> my dead<WH4191> out of my sight<WH6440>, hear<WH8085> me<WH6293>, and entreat for me to Ephron<WH6085> the son<WH1121> of Zohar<WH6714>,

that he may give<WH5414> me the cave<WH4631> of Machpelah<WH4375>, which he hath<WH7097>, which is in the end of his field<WH7704>; for the<WH4392> full<WH4392> price<WH3701> let him give it<WH5414> to me in the midst of you<WH8432> for a possession<WH272> of a burying-place<WH6913>.

Now Ephron<WH6085> was sitting<WH3427> in the midst<WH8432> of the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>: and Ephron<WH6085> the Hittite<WH2850> answered<WH6030> Abraham<WH85> in the audience<WH241> of the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>, even of all that went in<WH935> at the gate<WH8179> of his city<WH5892>, saying<WH559>,

Nay <WH3808>, my lord<WH113>, hear me<WH8085>: the field<WH7704> give I<WH5414> thee<WH4631>, and the cave that is therein<WH5414>, I give it thee<WH5869>; in the presence of the children<WH1121> of my people<WH5971> give<WH5414> I it thee<WH6912>: bury thy dead<WH4191>.
And Abraham<WH85> bowed himself down<WH7812> before<WH6440> the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776>.

And he spake<WH1696> unto Ephron<WH6085> in the audience<WH241> of the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776>, saying<WH559>, But if thou wilt<WH8085>, I pray thee, hear me<WH5414>: I will give the price<WH3701> of the field<WH7704>; take<WH3947> it of me<WH6912>, and I will bury my dead there<WH4191>.
And Ephron<WH6085> answered<WH6030> Abraham<WH85>, saying unto him<WH559>,

My lord<WH113>, hearken<WH8085> unto me<WH776>: a piece of land worth four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> shekels<WH8255> of silver<WH3701>, what is that betwixt<WH996> me and thee<WH6912>? bury therefore thy dead<WH4191>.

And Abraham<WH85> hearkened<WH8085> unto Ephron<WH6085>; and Abraham<WH85> weighed<WH8254> to Ephron<WH6085> the silver<WH3701> which he had named<WH1696> in the audience<WH241> of the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>, four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> shekels<WH8255> of silver<WH3701>, current<WH5674> money with the merchant<WH5503>.

So the field<WH7704> of Ephron<WH6085>, which was in Machpelah<WH4375>, which was before<WH6440> Mamre<WH4471>, the field<WH7704>, and the cave<WH4631> which was therein<WH6086>, and all the trees that were in the field<WH7704>, that were in all the border<WH1366> thereof round about<WH5439>, were made sure<WH6965>
unto Abraham<WH85> for a possession<WH4736> in the presence<WH5869> of the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>, before all that went in<WH935> at the gate<WH8179> of his city<WH5892>.

And after<WH310> this<WH3651>, Abraham<WH85> buried<WH6912> Sarah<WH8283> his wife<WH802> in the cave<WH4631> of the field<WH7704> of Machpelah<WH4375> before<WH6440> Mamre<WH4471> (the same is Hebron<WH2275>), in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>.
And the field<WH7704>, and the cave<WH4631> that is therein<WH6965>, were made sure unto Abraham<WH85> for a possession<WH272> of a burying-place<WH6913> by the children<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845>.
